log.content: Create me a website about 3d printers. Make it technical and informative, including information such as calibration, what process should be followed after changing filament etc. Add lots of detail and use a modern design language with the main color being orange. You should create multiple pages, but make sure the main page is available in index.html

function.name: create_file
create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"index.html","content":" 3D Printer Technical Guide

3D Printer Technical Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change Process FAQ Contact

Welcome to the 3D Printing Technical Resource

This site provides detailed technical information about 3D printers, focusing on maintenance, calibration, and best practices. Explore the following sections:

  • Calibration: Learn how to calibrate your printer for optimal performance.
  • Filament Change Process: Step-by-step guide to changing filament without issues.
  • FAQ: Answers to common technical questions.
  • Contact: Reach out for more information or support.
"}

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"calibration.html","content":" Calibration Guide

3D Printer Technical Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change Process FAQ Contact

Printer Calibration Guide

Bed Leveling

  1. Home the printer and move nozzle to each corner.
  2. Use a piece of paper to check clearance between nozzle and bed.
  3. Adjust bed screws until paper moves with slight resistance.
  4. Repeat for all corners until bed is level.

Extruder Calibration

  1. Measure filament flow using a ruler and extrusion test.
  2. Adjust extruder steps/mm in firmware if under/over-extruding.
  3. Calibrate retraction settings to prevent stringing.

Temperature Calibration

  1. Use a thermocouple to verify nozzle temperature accuracy.
  2. Adjust temperature PID values in firmware if discrepancies exist.
"}

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"filament-change.html","content":" Filament Change Process

3D Printer Technical Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change Process FAQ Contact

Filament Change Process

Steps for Smooth Transitions

  1. Preheat nozzle to filament's melting temperature (+10°C).
  2. Unload current filament via printer's control menu.
  3. Insert new filament into extruder.
  4. Purge until new filament flows consistently (10-20cm).
  5. Check extrusion rate and adjust if necessary.

Troubleshooting

  • Bubbles in filament: Increase temperature by 5°C increments.
  • No extrusion: Check nozzle clog and perform cold pull.
  • Color mixing: Purge longer or use a nozzle cleaner.
"}

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"faq.html","content":" FAQ

3D Printer Technical Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change Process FAQ Contact

FAQ

Why is my print under-extruding?

Common causes: low temperature, clogged nozzle, or misconfigured extruder steps. Check calibration and perform a cold pull.

How do I fix bed adhesion issues?

Ensure bed is level, use adhesive spray, and confirm correct first layer height (0.1-0.15mm).

What causes warping on corners?

Insufficient bed adhesion, low ambient temperature, or over-cooling. Use a heated bed, apply glue stick, and reduce cooling fan speed.

"}
